greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle P, read by rows, that satisfies [P^-1](n,k) = P(n+1,k+1) for n >= k >= 0, with P(k,k)=1 and P(k+1,1)=P(k+1,0) for k >= 0, where [P^-1] denotes the matrix inverse of P.
formula: The g.f. of column k of matrix power P^m (ignoring leading zeros) is:
example: where P^-1 shifts columns left and up one place:
program: (PARI) {P(n,k,q=-1) = local(A=Mat(1),B); if(n<k||k<0,0, for(m=1,n+1, B = matrix(m,m); for(i=1,m, for(j=1,i, if(j==i, B[i,j]=1, if(j==1, B[i,j]=(A^q)[i-1,1], B[i,j] = (A^q)[i-1,j-1]));)); A=B); return(A[n+1,k+1]))}
results.author: _Paul D. Hanna_, Aug 23 2005
